Key Match Events: Orbelin Pineda volleyed home Mexico’s first goal from their last three games.
Cesar Huerta doubled the lead early in the second half with a right-footed shot.
Luis Romo’s shot from outside the box found the bottom right corner for Mexico’s third goal.
Pre-Game Insights: Without Guillermo Ochoa, Edson Álvarez, Raúl Jiménez or Hirving “Chucky” Lozano on the roster, a new group of talent put their best foot forward in the new Aguirre era.
Post-Match Reflections: It took less than five minutes for the Oceanic side to concede after failing to clear the ball in the box.
Despite El Tri dominating the match with 13 shots to two, New Zealand’s defence managed to keep them tame.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Javier Aguirre’s third stint in charge of the Mexico Men’s National Team began with a statement 3-0 win over New Zealand on Saturday.
New Zealand had to wait until the 70th minute to register their first effort on target via Matthew Garbett in what will be a night to forget.
